items.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
items.recipe:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
 2. Cream together the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla.
 3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Stir in the chocolate chips.
 4. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets.
 5. Bake for 10-12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Let cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

items.title: Chicken Curry
items.recipe:
1. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat.
 2. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
 3. Add the ginger paste and garlic paste to the pan. Sauté for a minute until fragrant.
 4. Add the chicken pieces to the pan and cook until they are lightly browned on all sides.
 5. In a small bowl, mix together the curry powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and a little water to make a paste.
 6. Add the spice paste to the pan and cook for a couple of minutes, stirring well to coat the chicken.
 7. Pour in the tomato puree and season with salt. Mix well.
 8. Cover the pan and let the chicken cook in the tomato gravy for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
 9. Sprinkle garam masala over the chicken curry and stir to combine.
 10. Garnish with freshly chopped cilantro leaves.
 11. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

items.title: Fish Curry
items.recipe:
1. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat.
 2. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
 3. Add the ginger paste and garlic paste to the pan. Sauté for a minute until fragrant.
 4. Add the fish fillets to the pan and cook until they are lightly browned on both sides.
 5. In a small bowl, mix together the curry powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and a little water to make a paste.
 6. Add the spice paste to the pan and cook for a couple of minutes, stirring well to coat the fish.
 7. Pour in the tomato puree and season with salt. Mix well.
 8. Cover the pan and let the fish cook in the tomato gravy for about 15-20 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
 9. Sprinkle garam masala over the fish curry and stir to combine.
 10. Garnish with freshly chopped cilantro leaves.
 11. Serve hot with steamed rice or naan bread.

items.title: Prawn Curry
items.recipe:
1. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat.
 2. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
 3. Add the ginger paste and garlic paste to the pan. Sauté for a minute until fragrant.
 4. Add the prawns to the pan and cook until they turn pink and are cooked through.
 5. In a small bowl, mix together the curry powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and a little water to make a paste.
 6. Add the spice paste to the pan and cook for a couple of minutes, stirring well to coat the prawns.
 7. Pour in the tomato puree and season with salt. Mix well.
 8. Cover the pan and let the prawns cook in the tomato gravy for about 5-7 minutes, or until the flavors meld together.
 9. Sprinkle garam masala over the prawn curry and stir to combine.
 10. Garnish with freshly chopped cilantro leaves.
 11. Serve hot with steamed rice or naan bread.

items.title: Mutton Curry
items.recipe:
1. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat.
 2. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
 3. Add the ginger paste and garlic paste to the pan. Sauté for a minute until fragrant.
 4. Add the mutton pieces to the pan and cook until they are browned on all sides.
 5. In a small bowl, mix together the curry powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and a little water to make a paste.
 6. Add the spice paste to the pan and cook for a couple of minutes, stirring well to coat the mutton.
 7. Pour in the tomato puree and season with salt. Mix well.
 8. Cover the pan and let the mutton cook in the tomato gravy for about 1-2 hours, or until the meat is tender and cooked through.
 9. Sprinkle garam masala over the mutton curry and stir to combine.
 10. Garnish with freshly chopped cilantro leaves.
 11. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

items.title: Crab Curry
items.recipe:
1. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat.
 2. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
 3. Add the ginger paste and garlic paste to the pan. Sauté for a minute until fragrant.
 4. Add the crab pieces to the pan and cook until they turn reddish-orange and are partially cooked.
 5. In a small bowl, mix together the curry powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and a little water to make a paste.
 6. Add the spice paste to the pan and cook for a couple of minutes, stirring well to coat the crabs.
 7. Pour in the tomato puree and season with salt. Mix well.
 8. Cover the pan and let the crab cook in the tomato gravy for about 15-20 minutes, or until the crabs are fully cooked and the flavors meld together.
 9. Sprinkle garam masala over the crab curry and stir to combine.
 10. Garnish with freshly chopped cilantro leaves.
 11. Serve hot with steamed rice or naan bread.

items.title: Chicken Pizza
ingredients: 1 cup cooked chicken, shredded or diced
items.recipe:
1. Preheat the oven to the temperature specified on the pizza dough package.
 2. Roll out the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface to your desired thickness.
 3. Transfer the rolled-out dough to a greased pizza pan or baking sheet.
 4. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
 5. Sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
 6. Distribute the cooked chicken, red onions, bell peppers, mushrooms, and black olives over the cheese.
 7. Drizzle the olive oil over the toppings and sprinkle with dried oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
 8. Place the pizza in the preheated oven and bake according to the pizza dough package instructions, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
 9. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
 10. Slice the pizza into wedges and serve hot.

items.title: Chicken Burger
items.recipe:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine ground chicken, bread crumbs, chopped onion, chopped bell pepper, minced garlic, Worcestershire sauce, dried oregano, paprika, salt, and black pepper. Mix well until all ingredients are evenly incorporated.
 2. Divide the chicken mixture into 4 equal portions and shape each portion into a patty.
 3. Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken patties for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until they are cooked through and reach an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
 4. Toast the burger buns on the grill or in a toaster.
 5. Assemble the burgers by spreading mayonnaise and ketchup on the bottom buns. Place a chicken patty on each bun, followed by lettuce leaves, sliced tomatoes, and sliced red onions.
 6. Cover with the top bun and serve the chicken burgers immediately.

items.title: Chicken Hotdog
items.recipe:
1. Preheat the grill or grill pan over medium heat.
 2. Place the chicken sausages on the grill and cook for about 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until they are cooked through and browned.
 3. While the sausages are grilling, prepare the toppings. In a small bowl, mix together the diced onions, diced bell peppers, diced pickles, ketchup, mustard, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
 4. Once the sausages are cooked, remove them from the grill and let them rest for a minute.
 5. Toast the hotdog buns on the grill for a minute or until lightly toasted.
 6. Place a cooked chicken sausage in each bun and top with the prepared onion and pepper mixture.
 7. Serve the chicken hotdogs with additional ketchup and mustard on the side, if desired.

items.title: Chicken Biryani
items.recipe:
1. Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain.
2. In a large pot, heat the ghee or vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the cinnamon stick, cloves, cardamom pods, and bay leaves. Cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
3. Add the thinly sliced onions to the pot and cook until they turn golden brown.
4. Add the ginger-garlic paste and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
5. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft.
6. Add the chicken pieces to the pot and cook until they are browned on all sides.
7. In a separate bowl, mix together the biryani masala, plain yogurt, chopped cilantro, chopped mint leaves, turmeric powder, and salt. Add this mixture to the pot and stir well.
8. Add the soaked and drained basmati rice to the pot and mix gently.
9. Pour water into the pot, ensuring that the water level is about 1 inch above the rice and chicken mixture.
10. Bring the water to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and let the biryani simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the flavors are well blended.
11. Once the biryani is cooked, remove it from heat and let it sit, covered, for 5 minutes.
12. Fluff the rice gently with a fork, and garnish with fried onions (optional).
13. Serve the chicken biryani hot with raita (yogurt sauce) or a side salad.

items.title: Mutton Biryani
items.recipe:
1. Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain.
2. In a large pot, heat the ghee or vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the cinnamon stick, cloves, cardamom pods, and bay leaves. Cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
3. Add the thinly sliced onions to the pot and cook until they turn golden brown.
4. Add the ginger-garlic paste and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
5. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft.
6. Add the mutton pieces to the pot and cook until they are browned on all sides.
7. In a separate bowl, mix together the biryani masala, plain yogurt, chopped mint leaves, chopped cilantro, turmeric powder, and salt. Add this mixture to the pot and stir well.
8. Add the soaked and drained basmati rice to the pot and mix gently.
9. Pour water into the pot, ensuring that the water level is about 1 inch above the rice and mutton mixture.
10. Bring the water to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and let the biryani simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the flavors are well blended.
11. Once the biryani is cooked, remove it from heat and let it sit, covered, for 5 minutes.
12. Fluff the rice gently with a fork, and garnish with fried onions (optional).
13. Serve the mutton biryani hot with raita (yogurt sauce) or a side salad.

items.title: Chocolate Ice Cream
items.recipe:
1. In a saucepan, combine the heavy cream, whole milk, granulated sugar, and unsweetened cocoa powder. Heat the mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it begins to simmer.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks until they are well beaten.
3. Gradually pour about 1/2 cup of the hot cream mixture into the beaten egg yolks, whisking constantly. This will temper the eggs and prevent them from curdling.
4. Pour the tempered egg mixture back into the saucepan with the remaining cream mixture. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon. This should take about 5-7 minutes.
5. Remove the saucepan from heat and stir in the vanilla extract.
6. If desired, add the chocolate chips to the mixture and stir until they are fully melted and incorporated.
7. Allow the mixture to cool to room temperature, then cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
8. Once chilled, pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions.
9. Transfer the churned ice cream to an airtight container and freeze for at least 4 hours or until firm.
10. Serve the chocolate ice cream in bowls or cones, and enjoy!

items.title: Vanilla Ice Cream
items.recipe:
1. In a saucepan, combine the heavy cream, whole milk, and granulated sugar. Heat the mixture over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until it reaches a simmer.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks until they are well beaten.
3. Gradually pour about 1/2 cup of the hot cream mixture into the beaten egg yolks, whisking constantly. This will temper the eggs and prevent them from curdling.
4. Pour the tempered egg mixture back into the saucepan with the remaining cream mixture. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon. This should take about 5-7 minutes.
5. Remove the saucepan from heat and stir in the vanilla extract and salt.
6. Allow the mixture to cool to room temperature, then cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
7. Once chilled, pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions.
8. Transfer the churned ice cream to an airtight container and freeze for at least 4 hours or until firm.
9. Serve the vanilla ice cream in bowls or cones, and enjoy!

items.title: Jalebi
items.recipe:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, besan, and baking powder.
2. In a separate small bowl, mix the saffron strands with warm water and let it infuse for a few minutes.
3. Gradually add the yogurt and saffron water to the dry ingredients, mixing well to form a smooth batter. The consistency should be thick yet pourable. Let the batter rest for 15-20 minutes.
4. In a separate saucepan, prepare the sugar syrup by combining the granulated sugar and water. Heat over medium heat until the sugar dissolves completely. Add cardamom powder to the syrup and let it simmer for a few minutes until it slightly thickens. Remove from heat and keep the syrup warm.
5. Heat vegetable oil in a deep frying pan or kadai over medium heat.
6. Pour the jalebi batter into a squeeze bottle or a piping bag with a small nozzle.
7. Squeeze the batter into hot oil in a spiral or pretzel shape, making small to medium-sized jalebis. Fry until they turn golden brown and crispy, flipping them occasionally to ensure even cooking.
8. Once cooked, remove the jalebis from the oil using a slotted spoon and immediately dip them into the warm sugar syrup. Allow them to soak for a minute or two.
9. Remove the jalebis from the syrup and transfer them to a serving plate. Garnish with chopped nuts if desired.
10. Serve the jalebis warm and enjoy the sweet and syrupy treat!

items.title: Rasgulla
items.recipe:
1. In a large pot, bring the milk to a boil over medium heat. Once it starts boiling, add the lemon juice and stir gently until the milk curdles and separates into curds (chenna) and whey. Turn off the heat.
2. Line a colander with a cheesecloth or muslin cloth. Pour the curdled milk into the colander, allowing the whey to drain away. Rinse the curds under cold water to remove any traces of lemon juice.
3. Gather the edges of the cloth and squeeze out any excess liquid from the curds. Hang the cloth with the curds for about 30 minutes to allow further draining and firming.
4. After 30 minutes, remove the curds from the cloth and transfer them to a clean surface. Knead the curds with the heel of your hand for about 5-7 minutes until it forms a smooth and soft dough.
5. Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into smooth balls, applying gentle pressure. Make sure there are no cracks on the surface of the balls.
6. In a large pot, combine the granulated sugar, water, and saffron strands (if using). Bring the mixture to a boil, stirring until the sugar is completely dissolved.
7. Gently slide the prepared balls (rasgulla) into the boiling sugar syrup. Cover the pot with a lid and let it simmer over medium heat for about 10-12 minutes. The rasgullas will expand in size as they cook.
8. Remove the pot from heat and let the rasgullas cool down to room temperature. They will shrink slightly as they cool.
9. Once cooled, transfer the rasgullas along with the sugar syrup to a serving bowl. Sprinkle cardamom powder over the top and garnish with chopped pistachios.
10. Refrigerate the rasgullas for a few hours to chill before serving. Serve them cold and enjoy the sweet and spongy rasgullas!

items.title: chicken nuggets
items.recipe:
1. Cut the chicken breasts into bite-sized pieces, approximately 1-inch in size.
2. In a shallow dish, combine the flour, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper.
3. In a separate dish, place the beaten eggs.
4. Dip each piece of chicken into the flour mixture, coating it evenly. Shake off any excess flour.
5. Dip the coated chicken into the beaten eggs, ensuring it is fully coated.
6. Roll the chicken in the breadcrumbs, pressing gently to adhere the breadcrumbs to the chicken.
7. Place the breaded chicken nuggets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and refrigerate for 20-30 minutes. This will help the coating set and adhere to the chicken.
8. Heat vegetable oil in a deep frying pan or skillet over medium heat. The oil should be approximately 1 inch deep.
9. Carefully place the chicken nuggets into the hot oil, ensuring they are not overcrowded. Fry for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
10. Once cooked, remove the chicken nuggets from the oil using a slotted spoon and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
11. Serve the chicken nuggets hot with your favorite dipping sauces or as a side dish. Enjoy!

items.title: chicken sandwich
ingredients: Butter or cooking oil for grilling
items.recipe:
1. Season the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
2. Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium heat and add butter or cooking oil.
3. Cook the chicken breasts for about 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through and no longer pink in the center. Remove from heat and let them rest for a few minutes.
4. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well to make the sauce.
5. Toast the slices of bread until lightly golden.
6. Spread the sauce on one side of each bread slice.
7. Place a lettuce leaf on two slices of bread.
8. Slice the cooked chicken breasts and arrange the slices on top of the lettuce.
9. Top the chicken with tomato slices and cheese slices.
10. Cover with the remaining bread slices, sauce-side down.
11. Heat a clean grill pan or skillet over medium heat and add butter or cooking oil.
12. Place the sandwiches on the pan and cook for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until the bread is toasted and the cheese is melted.
13. Remove from heat and let the sandwiches cool for a minute.
14. Cut the sandwiches diagonally into halves or quarters.
15. Serve the chicken sandwiches and enjoy!

items.title: Chicken Lollipop
items.recipe:
1. Prepare the chicken wings by separating the drumettes from the wingettes. Remove the skin and discard the tips.
2. In a bowl, mix together soy sauce, ginger-garlic paste, chili sauce, tomato ketchup, cornstarch, red chili powder, black pepper powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, and salt to make a marinade.
3. Add the chicken wings to the marinade and mix well, ensuring the wings are coated evenly. Let them marinate for at least 1 hour, or refrigerate overnight for better flavor.
4. Heat oil in a deep frying pan or skillet over medium heat.
5. Once the oil is hot, carefully add the marinated chicken wings, one by one, into the hot oil. Fry them in batches to avoid overcrowding.
6. Fry the chicken wings for about 8-10 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy. Flip them occasionally for even cooking.
7. Remove the chicken lollipops from the oil and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
8. Serve the chicken lollipops hot as an appetizer or snack. They pair well with a dipping sauce of your choice.
9. Enjoy your delicious Chicken Lollipops!

items.title: Chicken Rolls
items.recipe:
1. Season the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika.
2. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken breasts for about 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through and no longer pink in the center. Remove from heat and let them cool.
3. Once cooled, slice the cooked chicken breasts into thin strips.
4. In a small bowl, mix together mayonnaise, Greek yogurt, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to make a creamy sauce.
5. Lay out a tortilla wrap on a clean surface.
6. Spread a generous amount of the creamy sauce onto the tortilla wrap.
7. Place a layer of shredded lettuce on top of the sauce.
8. Arrange the sliced chicken strips, bell peppers, and onions on the lettuce.
9. Roll up the tortilla tightly, tucking in the sides as you go.
10. Repeat the process with the remaining tortilla wraps and fillings.
11. Heat a clean skillet over medium heat and lightly brush it with oil.
12. Place the rolled tortilla wraps on the skillet and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the wraps are lightly toasted and the filling is warm.
13. Remove from heat and let the chicken rolls cool for a minute.
14. Slice the chicken rolls diagonally into halves or smaller portions.
15. Serve the chicken rolls as a delicious and convenient meal or snack. Enjoy!

items.title: Chicken Butter Masala
ingredients: 1.5 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs or breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro (coriander) leaves for garnish
items.recipe:
1. In a bowl, combine the yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cinnamon powder, and salt. Mix well.
2. Add the chicken pieces to the marinade and coat them evenly. Let the chicken marinate for at least 30 minutes, or refrigerate overnight for enhanced flavor.
3. Heat 2 tablespoons of butter in a large skillet or pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until golden brown and caramelized.
4. Remove the onions from the pan and set them aside.
5. In the same pan, add the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter. Add the marinated chicken pieces and cook until they are browned and cooked through.
6. Stir in the garam masala and tomato puree. Cook for a few minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
7. Reduce the heat to low and gradually add the heavy cream, stirring continuously. Simmer the chicken butter masala for 5-7 minutes to allow the sauce to thicken.
8. Add the caramelized onions back into the pan and stir well.
9. Taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
10. Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro (coriander) leaves.
11. Serve the chicken butter masala hot with naan, rice, or your choice of bread. Enjoy the rich and flavorful dish!

items.title: Brownies
items.recipe:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a 9x13-inch baking pan.
2. In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the butter. Allow it to cool slightly.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the melted butter and granulated sugar. Stir until well combined.
4. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla extract.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, and salt.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Be careful not to overmix.
7. If desired, fold in the chocolate chips.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan, spreading it evenly.
9. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with a few moist crumbs.
10. Remove the pan from the oven and let the brownies cool completely in the pan.
11. Once cooled, cut the brownies into squares and serve.
12. Enjoy your delicious homemade brownies!

items.title: Cheesecake
items.recipe:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (160°C).
2. In a medium bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and 1/4 cup of granulated sugar. Mix until the crumbs are evenly coated.
3. Press the crumb mixture into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan, forming an even crust. Set aside.
4. In a large mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese, 1 cup of granulated sugar, and vanilla extract until smooth and creamy.
5. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
6. Mix in the sour cream and flour until just combined. Be careful not to overmix.
7. Pour the cream cheese mixture over the prepared crust in the springform pan.
8. Smooth the top with a spatula to create an even layer.
9. Place the cheesecake in the preheated oven and bake for 50-60 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly jiggly.
10. Turn off the oven and leave the cheesecake in the oven with the door slightly ajar for about 1 hour.
11. Remove the cheesecake from the oven and let it cool completely at room temperature.
12. Once cooled, refrigerate the cheesecake for at least 4 hours, or overnight, to set.
13. Before serving, remove the sides of the springform pan and transfer the cheesecake to a serving plate.
14. Slice and serve chilled. You can garnish with fruit, chocolate sauce, or whipped cream if desired.
15. Enjoy your homemade cheesecake!

items.title: Kheer
ingredients: 2 tablespoons chopped nuts (almonds, pistachios, cashews, etc.)
items.recipe:
1. Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes and then drain.
2. In a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan, heat the ghee over medium heat. Add the drained rice and sauté for a couple of minutes until the rice turns slightly golden and fragrant.
3. Pour in the whole milk and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and let the milk simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 30-40 minutes until the rice is cooked and the milk thickens. Keep scraping the sides and bottom of the pan to avoid sticking.
4. Add the condensed milk and sugar to the pan. Stir well until the sugar is dissolved and the kheer becomes creamy.
5. Add the cardamom powder, chopped nuts, and raisins to the kheer. Mix well and let it simmer for another 5 minutes.
6. If using saffron strands, soak them in a tablespoon of warm milk for a few minutes and then add the saffron milk to the kheer. This will give a beautiful golden color and aroma to the kheer.
7. Remove the kheer from heat and let it cool slightly. It will thicken further as it cools.
8. Serve the kheer warm or chilled, garnished with additional chopped nuts. Enjoy!

items.title: Sandesh
items.recipe:
1. In a mixing bowl, crumble the paneer until it becomes smooth and lump-free.
2. Add the powdered sugar and cardamom powder to the crumbled paneer. Mix well until the sugar is fully incorporated and the mixture becomes smooth.
3. If using saffron strands, soak them in a tablespoon of warm milk for a few minutes and then add the saffron milk to the paneer mixture. This will give a nice color and flavor to the Sandesh.
4. Transfer the paneer mixture to a non-stick pan or a heavy-bottomed pan.
5. Cook the mixture on low heat, stirring continuously, until it thickens and starts to leave the sides of the pan. This should take about 8-10 minutes.
6. Remove the pan from heat and let the mixture cool slightly.
7. Once the mixture is cool enough to handle, take small portions of the mixture and shape them into small, round discs or any desired shape. You can also use molds for shaping.
8. Garnish each Sandesh with a sprinkle of chopped pistachios.
9. Place the Sandesh in the refrigerator for at least 1-2 hours to set.
10. Serve the Sandesh chilled and enjoy the delightful sweet treat!

items.title: Shahi Tukda
ingredients: Chopped nuts for garnish (almonds, pistachios, etc.)
items.recipe:
1. Trim the edges of the bread slices and cut them into triangular or rectangular pieces.
2. In a deep pan, heat the ghee over medium heat. Fry the bread pieces in the ghee until they turn golden brown and crispy. Remove them from the pan and set them aside.
3. In the same pan, add the milk and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the milk thickens.
4. Add the condensed milk, sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron strands to the pan. Mix well and continue to simmer for another 5 minutes.
5. Remove the pan from heat and let the milk mixture cool slightly.
6. Dip each fried bread piece into the milk mixture, ensuring that it is well coated on both sides. Place the soaked bread pieces on a serving plate.
7. Pour any remaining milk mixture over the bread slices, ensuring they are well soaked.
8. Garnish the Shahi Tukda with chopped nuts and silver leaf (if using).
9. Refrigerate the Shahi Tukda for at least 1-2 hours to allow it to set.
10. Serve the Shahi Tukda chilled and enjoy the rich and indulgent dessert!

1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). 2. Spread the pizza sauce over the crust. 3. Sprinkle with the mozzarella cheese and your favorite toppings. 4. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
